newsitem.title: USA: Northern States Power restarts Minn. nuclear unit.
newsitem.headline: Northern States Power restarts Minn. nuclear unit.

text.p: Northern States Power Co's 503 megawatt (MW) Prairie Island 1 nuclear power plant restarted its reactor and is likely to be back on line later today, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said Monday.
The unit, in Red Wing, Minnesota, has been down since June 2, when it autumatically tripped off line after a rod control cabinet malfunctioned.
The adjacent unit Prairie Island 2, rated at 500 MW, continued to operate at full power.
The Prairie Island nuclear facility is fully owned and operated by Northern States Power Co.
